intro: Dombeya ambatosoratrensis subsp. ambatosoratrensis, commonly known as the Ambatosoratra dombeya, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the rainforests of eastern Madagascar. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a velvety texture. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution.
